00038 /// @brief Creates a new Dabg object and inits it
00039 affx::Dabg::Dabg()
00040 {
00041   clear();
00042 }

00044 /// @brief               Creates a new Dabg object with space reserved.
00045 /// @param chip_cap      reserve space for this many chips
00046 /// @param intensity_cap reserve space for this many intensities per chip
00047 affx::Dabg::Dabg(int capacity)
00048 {
00049   clear();
00050   intensity_reserve(capacity);
00051 }
00052 
00053 /// @brief Initialize the object to empty.
00054 void
00055 affx::Dabg::clear()
00056 {
00057   is_prepared=0;
00058 
00059   data.resize(AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+1);
00060   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00061     data[gcbin].clear();
00062   }
00063 }
00064 
00065 /// @brief          reserve space for intensity values
00066 /// @param chip_idx the chip to reserve space for.
00067 void
00068 affx::Dabg::intensity_reserve(int capacity)
00069 {
00070   // capacity is the total number of probes
00071   // each gc_vector will have a fraction of the probes.
00072   int gcbin_capacity_guess;
00073   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00074     // estimate capacitys for the bins.
00075     if ((gcbin<5)||(gcbin>19)) {
00076       gcbin_capacity_guess=capacity*0.0005;
00077     }
00078     else if ((gcbin<10)||(gcbin>16)) {
00079       gcbin_capacity_guess=capacity*0.0800;
00080     }
00081     else {
00082       gcbin_capacity_guess=capacity*0.1600;
00083     }
00084     //
00085     data[gcbin].reserve(gcbin_capacity_guess);
00086   }
00087 }
00088 
00089 size_t
00090 affx::Dabg::intensity_count(int gc_idx)
00091 {
00092   return data.at(gc_idx).size();
00093 }

00095 /// @brief     Copy the reservations from another dabg
00096 /// @param     dabg_from     Dabg to copy from
00097 void
00098 affx::Dabg::intensity_reserve_copy(affx::Dabg& dabg_from)
00099 {
00100   data.resize(AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+1);
00101   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00102     data[gcbin].reserve(dabg_from.data[gcbin].size());
00103   }
00104 }

00106 /// @brief add a vector of background intensities
00107 /// @param chip_idx      the index of the chip to add to
00108 /// @param gc_vec        a vector of gc content of the intensity values
00109 /// @param intensity_vec a vector of the intensity values 
00110 void
00111 affx::Dabg::add_intensitiy_vec(std::vector<int> gc_vec,std::vector<float> intensity_vec)
00112 {
00113   assert(gc_vec.size()==intensity_vec.size());
00114 
00115   is_prepared=0; // not ready
00116 
00117   uint32_t gc_vec_size=gc_vec.size();
00118   for (uint32_t i=0;i<gc_vec_size;i++) {
00119     data[gc_vec[i]].push_back(intensity_vec[i]);
00120   }
00121 }

00123 /// @brief             Add a single intensity
00124 /// @param chip_idx    the chip to add it to.
00125 /// @param gcbin       the gc value of this probe
00126 /// @param intensity   the intensity value of this probe
00127 void
00128 affx::Dabg::add_intensity(int gcbin,affx::Dabg::intensity_t intensity)
00129 {
00130   is_prepared=0; // not ready
00131   data[gcbin].push_back(intensity);
00132 }

00134 //! prepare this object for use.
00135 //! At the moment, this just means sorting the vectors.
00136 //! also see prepare_maybe in "Dabg.h"
00137 /// @brief   prepare the object for use (sort all the intensities)
00138 void 
00139 affx::Dabg::prepare()
00140 {
00141   // printf("PREPARE!!!\n"); // 
00142   for (uint32_t gcbin=0;gcbin<data.size();gcbin++) {
00143     sort(data[gcbin].begin(),data[gcbin].end());
00144   }
00145   is_prepared=1; // ready
00146 }
00147 
00148 /// @brief            Convert an intensity to a p-value
00149 /// @param chip       which chip to use
00150 /// @param gcbin      which gc bin the probe is in
00151 /// @param intensity  the intensity of the probe
00152 /// @return           the probablity that this p-value is above the background.
00153 /// @remark
00154 //! this is the left-tail probablity.  
00155 //! Prob=value is larger than all items to the left.
00156 //! vectors are sorted in increasing order.
00157 double
00158 affx::Dabg::intensity_to_pvalue(int gcbin,Dabg::intensity_t intensity)
00159 {
00160   double theval,pval;
00161   //Dabg::intensity_t val;
00162   // insure data is prepared (ie sorted)
00163   prepare_maybe();
00164 
00165   int l_idx;
00166   //int u_idx;
00167   l_idx=0;
00168 
00169   int icnt=data[gcbin].size();
00170   //printf("icnt=%d\n",icnt);
00171   // no values?
00172   if (icnt==0) {
00173     pval=0; // this will be inverted.
00174   } 
00175   // one value?
00176   else if (icnt==1) {
00177     theval=data[gcbin][0];
00178     if (intensity<theval) {
00179       pval=0.0; // perl dabg returns 1; we invert
00180     }
00181     else if (intensity>theval) {
00182       pval=1.0; // perl dabg returns 0; we invert
00183     }
00184     else {
00185       pval=0.5;
00186     }
00187   } 
00188   else {
00189     // l_idx is the index of the value ">=" intensity
00190     l_idx=std::lower_bound(data[gcbin].begin(),data[gcbin].end(),intensity)
00191       - data[gcbin].begin();
00192     // fix it up to be less than intensity
00193     if (l_idx==icnt) {
00194       l_idx=icnt-1;
00195     }
00196     pval=((double)l_idx)/((double)icnt);
00197   }
00198 
00199   // now that we have our pval, invert it for our chances of being greater.
00200   pval=(1.0-pval);
00201   
00202   //printf("dabg: intensity_to_pvalue(%2d,%2d,%8.4f)=%8.4f\n",chip,gcbin,intensity,pval);
00203   //printf("dabg: n=%3d : in=%3d : %10.6f : pos=%3d : val=%3d\n",
00204   //       (int)data[gcbin].size(),(int)intensity,pval,l_idx,(int)data[gcbin][l_idx]);
00205   return pval;
00206 }

00208 /// @brief       Dump the contents of the object
00209 /// @param level The level of verbosity
00210 /// @remark
00211 //! level=0: summary
00212 //! level=1: gcbins with sizes>0
00213 //! level=2: all gcbins
00214 //! level=3: all data
00215 void
00216 affx::Dabg::dump(int level)
00217 {
00218   printf("Dabg dump (%d) ==========\n",level);
00219 
00220   if (level==0) { return; }
00221 
00222   for (uint32_t gcbin=0;gcbin<data.size();gcbin++) {
00223     int v_size=(int)data[gcbin].size();
00224     int v_cap=(int)data[gcbin].capacity();
00225     if ((level>=2)||((level>=1)&&(v_size>0))) {
00226       printf("# data[gcbin=%2d]==%d/%d\n",gcbin,v_size,v_cap);
00227       if (level>=3) {
00228         for (uint32_t i=0;i<data[gcbin].size();i++) {
00229           printf("%3d: %f\n",i,(double)data[gcbin][i]);
00230         }
00231       }
00232     }
00233   }
00234 }

00238 /// @brief       Compute the targets and pvals for all the chips.
00239 /// @param probe_cnt   number of probes
00240 /// @param gc_arr      array of probe gc values
00241 /// @param pm_arr      array of probe pm intensities
00242 /// @param target_arr  output array of target probabilities
00243 /// @param pvalues_arr output array of probe probabilities
00244 //void
00245 //Dabg::rundabg(int probe_cnt,
00246 //              int* gc_arr,double** pm_arr,
00247 //              double* target_arr,double** pvalues_arr)
00248 //{
00249 //  for (int idx=0;idx<cel_cnt;idx++) {
00250 //    rundabg_idx(idx,probe_cnt,gc_arr,pm_arr[idx],&target_arr[idx],pvalues_arr[idx]);
00251 //  }
00252 //}
00253 
00254 /// @brief          Compute the target and pvals for one chip.
00255 /// @param chip_idx    Index of the chip
00256 /// @param probe_cnt   number of probes in set
00257 /// @param gc_arr      gc values of the probles
00258 /// @param pm_arr      pm intensity values of the probles
00259 /// @param target      Output: probability of the probset above background.
00260 /// @param pval_arr    Output: probability of the probe above background
00261 void
00262 affx::Dabg::compute_target_fisher(int probe_cnt,int* gc_arr,double* pm_arr,int dof_adjustment,
00263                                   double* out_target,double* out_pval_arr)
00264 {
00265   double pval_product;
00266 
00267   // fill pvalues_arr and compute product
00268   pval_product=0.0;
00269   for (int pi=0;pi<probe_cnt;pi++) {
00270     out_pval_arr[pi]=intensity_to_pvalue(gc_arr[pi],(affx::Dabg::intensity_t)pm_arr[pi]);
00271     pval_product=pval_product+log(out_pval_arr[pi]);
00272     //printf("dabg2: pi=%2d pm=%12.8f pval=%12.8f  product=%12.8f\n",pi,pm_arr[pi],pval[pi],pval_product);
00273   }
00274 
00275   /// @todo This should be replaced with a constant bias rather than a step function.
00276   if (pval_product==0.0) {
00277     pval_product=0.000001; // copied from perl
00278   }
00279   
00280   /// @todo  Why '-2*'?
00281   double test_statistic=-2*pval_product;
00282   *out_target=affxstat::chisqrprob(2*probe_cnt - dof_adjustment,(float)test_statistic);
00283   //printf("dabg2: test_statistic=%12.8f\n",test_statistic);
00284   //printf("dabg2: target=%12.8f\n",*target);
00285 }
00286 
00287 void
00288 affx::Dabg::compute_target_percentile(int probe_cnt,int* gc_arr,double* pm_arr,
00289                                       double per_cut,
00290                                       double* out_target,double* out_pval_arr)
00291 {
00292     // in bounds
00293   assert(per_cut>=0.0);
00294   assert(per_cut<=1.0);
00295   //
00296   std::vector<double> pval_vec;
00297   pval_vec.reserve(probe_cnt);
00298 
00299   // fill pvalues_arr and compute product
00300   for (int pi=0;pi<probe_cnt;pi++) {
00301     // save one to return
00302     out_pval_arr[pi]=intensity_to_pvalue(gc_arr[pi],(affx::Dabg::intensity_t)pm_arr[pi]);
00303     // save one to work with.
00304     pval_vec.push_back(out_pval_arr[pi]);
00305     //printf("pval_arr[%d]=%f\n",pi,out_pval_arr[pi]);
00306   }
00307 
00308   // only one value, so return it as the answer.
00309   if (pval_vec.size()==1) {
00310     *out_target=pval_vec[0];
00311   }
00312   // 
00313   else {
00314     // the order is ascending...
00315     sort(pval_vec.begin(),pval_vec.end());
00316     // so we need to invert per_cutoff
00317     //per_cut=1.0-per_cut;
00318     // now lookup the pvalue (and interpolate)
00319     double pos=per_cut*(probe_cnt-1);
00320     int    idx=(int)pos;
00321     *out_target=pval_vec[idx]+((pos-idx)*(pval_vec[idx+1]-pval_vec[idx]));
00322     //printf("target=%f\n",*out_target);
00323   }
00324 }

00326 /// @todo Turn these into ">>" and "<<" operators.
00327 
00328 void
00329 affx::Dabg::dabgfile_write(const std::string& filename)
00330 {
00331   std::fstream file;
00332 
00333   file.open(filename.c_str(),std::fstream::out);
00334   file << "# This is a dabg data file. Format: (bin[0-25] count \\n (value \\n)* \\n)*\n";
00335 
00336   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00337     file << gcbin << "    " << data[gcbin].size() << "\n";
00338     int i_max=data[gcbin].size();
00339     for (int i=0;i<i_max;i++) {
00340       file << data[gcbin][i] << "\n";
00341     }
00342     file << "\n";
00343   }
00344     
00345   file.close();
00346 }

00348 
00349 void
00350 affx::Dabg::dabgfile_read(const std::string& filename)
00351 {
00352   std::fstream file;
00353   char line[1000];
00354 
00355   // zero out the contents
00356   clear(); 
00357 
00358   file.open(filename.c_str(),std::fstream::in);
00359   // discard first line of the file
00360   file.getline(line,sizeof(line));
00361 
00362   //
00363   int gcbin_in;
00364   int gcbin_size;
00365   float val;
00366   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00367     file >> gcbin_in;
00368     assert(gcbin_in==gcbin);
00369     file >> gcbin_size;
00370     data[gcbin].reserve(gcbin_size);
00371     for (int i=0;i<gcbin_size;i++) {
00372       file >> val;
00373       data[gcbin].push_back(val);
00374     }
00375   }
00376 
00377   file.close();
00378 }
